Package com.rapidminer.belt.column

Class ColumnIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.column.ColumnIO
  • public final class ColumnIO
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows to put column data into ByteBuffers and create columns from ByteBuffer data.
    Author:
    Michael Knopf, Gisa Meier

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static int putCategoricalBytes​(Column column, int offset, java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
      Puts the category indices of the categorical column as (signed) byte values into the buffer.
      static int putCategoricalIntegers​(Column column, int offset, java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
      Puts the category indices of the categorical column as int values into the buffer.

      Puts the category indices of the categorical column as (signed) short values into the buffer.

      Puts the seconds since epoch of the date-time column as long values into the buffer.
      static int putDateTimeNanoInts​(Column column, int offset, java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
      Puts the subsecond part of the date-time column as nanosecond int values into the buffer.

      Puts the values of the numeric-readable column as double values into the buffer.

      Puts the values of the time column as long values representing the nanoseconds of day into the buffer.

      Creates a column builder for a Column.TypeId.DATE_TIME column of the given length.

      Creates a column builder for a Column.TypeId.INTEGER_53_BIT column of the given length where the data can be put via ByteBuffers containing double values.

      Creates a column builder for a Column.TypeId.NOMINAL column of the given length.

      Creates a column builder for a Column.TypeId.REAL column of the given length where the data can be put via ByteBuffers containing double values.
      static TimeColumnBuilder readTime​(int length)
      Creates a column builder for a Column.TypeId.TIME column of the given length where the data can be put via ByteBuffers containing long values representing nanoseconds of the day.

    • Method Detail

      • putNumericDoubles

        public static int putNumericDoubles​(Column column,
                                    int offset,
                                    java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Puts the values of the numeric-readable column as double values into the buffer.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to write as double values into the buffer, must be Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE
        offset - the row in the column to start from
        buffer - the buffer to write into
        Returns:
        the number of rows written into the buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the buffer or the column is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the offset is negative or bigger than the column size
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the column is not numeric readable

      • putTimeLongs

        public static int putTimeLongs​(Column column,
                               int offset,
                               java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Puts the values of the time column as long values representing the nanoseconds of day into the buffer. Missing values are represented by TimeColumn.MISSING_VALUE (Long.MAX_VALUE).
        Parameters:
        column - the column to write as long values into the buffer, must be a Column.TypeId.TIME column
        offset - the row in the column to start from
        buffer - the buffer to write into
        Returns:
        the number of rows written into the buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the buffer or the column is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the offset is negative or bigger than the column size
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the column is not a time column

      • putDateTimeLongs

        public static int putDateTimeLongs​(Column column,
                                   int offset,
                                   java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Puts the seconds since epoch of the date-time column as long values into the buffer. Missing values are represented by DateTimeColumn.MISSING_VALUE (Long.MAX_VALUE). For date-time columns with nanosecond precision (DateTimeColumn.hasSubSecondPrecision()), use putDateTimeNanoInts(Column, int, ByteBuffer) additionally.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to write as long values into the buffer, must be a Column.TypeId.DATE_TIME column
        offset - the row in the column to start from
        buffer - the buffer to write into
        Returns:
        the number of rows written into the buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the buffer or the column is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the offset is negative or bigger than the column size
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the column is not a date-time column

      • putDateTimeNanoInts

        public static int putDateTimeNanoInts​(Column column,
                                      int offset,
                                      java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Puts the subsecond part of the date-time column as nanosecond int values into the buffer. Should be used together with putDateTimeLongs(Column, int, ByteBuffer). If the date-time column has no subseconds (DateTimeColumn.hasSubSecondPrecision() then 0s are written.
        Parameters:
        column - the column of which to write the nanoseconds as int values into the buffer, must be a Column.TypeId.DATE_TIME column
        offset - the row in the column to start from
        buffer - the buffer to write into
        Returns:
        the number of rows written into the buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the buffer or the column is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the offset is negative or bigger than the column size
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the column is not a date-time column

      • putCategoricalIntegers

        public static int putCategoricalIntegers​(Column column,
                                         int offset,
                                         java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Puts the category indices of the categorical column as int values into the buffer. Use putCategoricalShorts(Column, int, ByteBuffer) or putCategoricalBytes(Column, int, ByteBuffer) if you want to save space and the dictionary is small enough to allow a representation by shorts or bytes.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to write as int values into the buffer, must be a Column.Category.CATEGORICAL column
        offset - the row in the column to start from
        buffer - the buffer to write into
        Returns:
        the number of rows written into the buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the buffer or the column is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the offset is negative or bigger than the column size
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the column is not a categorical column

      • putCategoricalShorts

        public static int putCategoricalShorts​(Column column,
                                       int offset,
                                       java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Puts the category indices of the categorical column as (signed) short values into the buffer. Use putCategoricalBytes(Column, int, ByteBuffer) if you want to save space and the dictionary is small enough to allow a representation by bytes. If there are too many dictionary entries to represent the category indices by shorts, use putCategoricalIntegers(Column, int, ByteBuffer) instead.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to write as short values into the buffer, must be a Column.Category.CATEGORICAL column and the Dictionary.maximalIndex() must be at most Short.MAX_VALUE
        offset - the row in the column to start from
        buffer - the buffer to write into
        Returns:
        the number of rows written into the buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the buffer or the column is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the offset is negative or bigger than the column size
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the column is not a categorical column or the dictionary has a maximal index bigger than Short.MAX_VALUE

      • putCategoricalBytes

        public static int putCategoricalBytes​(Column column,
                                      int offset,
                                      java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Puts the category indices of the categorical column as (signed) byte values into the buffer. Use putCategoricalShorts(Column, int, ByteBuffer) or putCategoricalIntegers(Column, int, ByteBuffer) instead if there are too many dictionary entries to represent the category indices by bytes.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to write as short values into the buffer, must be a Column.Category.CATEGORICAL column and the Dictionary.maximalIndex() must be at most Byte.MAX_VALUE
        offset - the row in the column to start from
        buffer - the buffer to write into
        Returns:
        the number of rows written into the buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the buffer or the column is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the offset is negative or bigger than the column size
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the column is not a categorical column or the dictionary has a maximal index bigger than Byte.MAX_VALUE

      • readReal

        public static NumericColumnBuilder readReal​(int length)
        Creates a column builder for a Column.TypeId.REAL column of the given length where the data can be put via ByteBuffers containing double values.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the column to construct
        Returns:
        the builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length is negative

      • readInteger53Bit

        public static NumericColumnBuilder readInteger53Bit​(int length)
        Creates a column builder for a Column.TypeId.INTEGER_53_BIT column of the given length where the data can be put via ByteBuffers containing double values.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the column to construct
        Returns:
        the builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length is negative

      • readTime

        public static TimeColumnBuilder readTime​(int length)
        Creates a column builder for a Column.TypeId.TIME column of the given length where the data can be put via ByteBuffers containing long values representing nanoseconds of the day.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the column to construct
        Returns:
        the builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length is negative

      • readDateTime

        public static DateTimeColumnBuilder readDateTime​(int length)
        Creates a column builder for a Column.TypeId.DATE_TIME column of the given length. The second data can be put via ByteBuffers containing long values representing seconds since epoch. Optionally, the nanosecond data can be put via ByteBuffers containing int values representing the subsecond part.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the column to construct
        Returns:
        the builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length is negative

      • readNominal

        public static NominalColumnBuilder readNominal​(java.util.LinkedHashSet<java.lang.String> dictionaryValues,
                                               int length)
        Creates a column builder for a Column.TypeId.NOMINAL column of the given length. The dictionary of the nominal column is defined via the dictionary values ordered set and the category indices can be put via ByteBuffers containing int, (signed) short or (signed) byte values.
        Parameters:
        dictionaryValues - the dictionary values matching the category indices to be read, must start with null
        length - the length of the column to construct
        Returns:
        the builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length is negative, the dictionary values are empty or do not start with null
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the dictionary values are null
